title: Mujica Gallo's Private Gold Collection and Weapons of the World Museum
description: Discover the glittering gold and ancient treasures of the Gold of Peru Museum on a private 3-hour tour from Lima. Delve into five rooms, each bursting with thousands of unique gold artifacts, with a knowledgeable guide and uncover the fascinating history of the precious metal. Also included in the tour is a visit the Weapons of the World Museum, an extensive collection of armory from a variety of countries. Convenient hotel pickup and drop-off is included.
all_descriptions: Discover the glittering gold and ancient treasures of the Gold of Peru Museum on a private 3-hour tour from Lima. Delve into five rooms, each bursting with thousands of unique gold artifacts, with a knowledgeable guide and uncover the fascinating history of the precious metal. Also included in the tour is a visit the Weapons of the World Museum, an extensive collection of armory from a variety of countries. Convenient hotel pickup and drop-off is included.

Depart from your hotel in Lima and venture to the cultural district of Surco to begin your opulent excursion. Peruse the exhibitions alongside your informative and interesting guide, admiring over 8,000 distinctive pieces from pre- and post-Inca civilization; watch gold glitter, silver shine and brass sparkle as you discover the pivotal role the metals played in Peru’s past. Observe the decorative items within each display, marveling at the artistic precision of masks depicting lizards, birds and monkeys.  

Next, venture to the Weapons of the World Museum, an exciting exhibition declared one of the world’s finest. Discover the powerful symbolism of weapons as you peruse over 20,000 artifacts form around the world; see ancient crossbows, fearsome swords and antique guns as you stroll through five gallery halls. When your tour concludes, return to your hotel in Lima in the minivan.
provider:

Scarlett Ruiz Alva
Lima, Peru29 contributions

Interesting to see only objects

May 2025 • Family
If you like to see only many historical objects, this is your ideal place.
There are no historical reviews to read
They had no guides or anyone to point you to the places
There's no order to start.
Inside there are shops open but it seems at the same time abandoned.
Without a guide you can not do a pleasant tour, the only fun for me was to see objects from different countries and years.
Take cash, I couldn't pay by card. They don’t give you a brochure, there is no QR’S to see if there are stories to listen to, it’s far away and getting there by bus is not easy, just by taxi, own car or bus with visiting groups.
Automatically translated
Written September 28, 2025

A big surprise

A place where you can enjoy the history of Peru, as well as items of great characters, you can enjoy the Inca culture and all the gold they left us to be able to surprise us daily today, the entrance has a price of 40 suns

Enrique Quinones
¡Muchas gracias por tu comentario! Nos alegra saber que disfrutaste de este increíble espacio lleno de historia y cultura. Es un privilegio poder compartir el legado inca y los tesoros que forman parte de nuestra identidad. Coincidimos contigo: cada rincón es una oportunidad para conectar con el pasado y admirar su grandeza. ¡Esperamos verte nuevamente para seguir explorando juntos lo mejor de nuestra historia!
Written November 25, 2024

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We're glad to hear that you enjoyed the museum, particularly the weapons collection. However, we apologize for any inconvenience caused by the guide not being well-informed about them. Your comments will be addressed internally to ensure that our guides receive proper training and information about all aspects of the museum.

reviews.title: Weapons and armor
reviews.text: I recommend visiting the Larco Museum first, as there is more information there. This is a private collection of Inca pieces, mainly gold pieces. Furthermore, it has a wonderful collection of weapons and armor from around the world, including a weapon that was given to Dom Pedro.Right at the entrance, they say you have to pay for a guide, who are historians who explain everything, but we didn't want to and went alone. Be careful, because the way they talk, it seems like you can't visit without a guide. And it's far away.

reviews.title: Discover the treasures of the people of Peru.
reviews.text: Surprising. In addition to a large and beautiful collection of gold pieces, there is a very rich collection of weapons and military equipment

reviews.title: Good collection!
reviews.text: Great informative guide Mayrol , quite the collection of gold , weapons and anthropological items . Good addition to Peru’s many gems . The museum could use better item labeling and identification if you go without a knowledgeable tour guide .

reviews.title: Private Tour Experience
reviews.text: Excellent experience with Vipac Travel the Lima provider. Not good experience with Tripadvisor, Tripadvisor has to improve customer communication.The provider picked us and returned us to the hotel via private transportation. The guide was a TRUE bilingual tour guide. He explained surrounding locations while traveling to/from the museum, and was knowledgeable of the gold collection. I would have liked more history on the arms part of the tour. The museum is fascinating on its gold & arms collection, breathtaking.It was a good PRIVATE tour experience.

reviews.title: Very interesting
reviews.text: The museum was very interesting. We took our time and look at all the fascinating items. Smaller kids would probably find it boring, but our teens were intrigued.
